list_definition.definition: the hole in which a key of a door etc is placed

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The child looked through the keyhole to see if his teacher was still with his parents.

list_ex_of_english: For example, the results of keyhole surgery and its effects on bed occupation have been dramatic.
Thirty years ago, there were no hip replacements, and keyhole surgery has advanced by leaps and bounds.
Furthermore, we have not listened at keyholes as well as some other people.
Only a keyhole, as it were, has to be dug.
We can peer through keyholes, move through open doors, glide into adjoining halls and rooms.
The repair can be made using keyhole surgery which, of course allows for the operation to take place without the patient's chest being opened-up, and the consequent trauma.
If you do by any chance sneak through the keyhole, that will be your good fortune, but it will not make much difference.
Keyhole surgery has also been subject to opprobrium.
